comment: Atlas is a beautiful browser with a very simple but powerful user interface. It makes the other browsers like Chrome or Firefox seem clunky and outdated. I gave this a chance and can't imagine going back. Nicely done!
title: Powerful but incredibly simple to use

comment: Please do yourself a fovour and download this fantastic browser. You won't go back.
title: That's what I'm talking about...

comment: This browser is super fast and great looking. The built in ad blocker is great. I do wish it had a way to import bookmarks from Chrome, though.
title: Best browser I have used on Android.

comment: 1-When closing the last tab available, please make the browser go to homepage/bookmarks instead of closing the app.2- Make closing the tabs easier, I mean by swiping them to the right.3- Make the browser open a link inside another app, like a mini browser maybe. Thanks ‚ò∫
title: Really really nice, fast,beautiful browser but....

comment: I liked the idea of allowing me to open the page in another app rather than new window, but I hope to add this feature for pages which already opened.. Be the first by adding this unavailable feature in other browsers üòâ
title: Add this feature please

comment: Nice browser but it seems like switching to mobile format does nothing? It won't even go when I go to a mobile site on purpose to goes to desktop
title: Nice

comment: Just what I need.
title: The best ever

comment: Could you add a translucent navbar?
Everything just awesome mainly ad blocker.. Just Problem with custom settings always goes to default when i open browser..please solve it..
title: Solve it please..!!

comment: Very smooth but default settings keep changing from mobile view back to desktop which is pretty annoying
title: Fast and fluid

comment: high speed browser
Awesome
Nice browser
title: Good

comment: Very smooth. Content filtering alone makes this worth using.
title: Great Browser

comment: Nice mobile-focused browser. I couldn't find the "Share" functionality anywhere, so unable to share to Pocket or Email, etc. etc. Pretty big missing feature.  Also turning off Dual-View mode leaves an artifact on the screen where the divider bar used to be. No way to get rid of it except exiting and reopening the app.
title: Nice mobile-focused browser, good start needs work

comment: Pretty snappy and visually appealing but the text reflow/resizing is pretty lacking.  Chrome Beta kills Atlas in this regard.  Were it not for this issue, Atlas would likely replace Chrome for me.  Keep at it,  Dev... This is a pretty good beta.
title: Not bad

comment: It looks nice, well most of it does. It's bothersome that there are these ugly parts of the app that ate not at all material or a similar design. Also the app itself functions poorly. When attempting to type in a password I was getting constant messed up zooming PR I literally couldn't select one of the input boxes, it would simply jump to another instead. Very very buggy.
title: Looks nice, functions... Eh

comment: I've tried many Android browsers and so far I am really liking Atlas. It's fast, stable and displays image heavy pages great. I also like how you can customize the display of a site (desktop/mobile) per address. I have been getting one annoying bug on Google search, it keeps prompting for location. If I choose allow our deny, it will still popup later.
title: Great beta

comment: Nice browser. Has an exceptional UI, very fast, smooth, intuitive. Would like to see a sharing feature and for it to use a little less battery. Looks like a replacement to Javelin has arrived. Thank you for such a nice browser.
title: Exceptional UI and fast
